content: Welcome to Rust L10N Team. This stream is intended as source of announcements for Rust L10N team.
@vertexclique Would you be able to send email or something to the localisation teams on pontoon that have streams. They need to be signed up on Zulip to be able to add them to a user group.
There is no integration for it iirc. Do you know? I would probably manually compile the list of people which is wrong in many directions.
Because people might contribute couple of lines and end up appeared in the team list on pontoon.
@vertexclique Well I meant just sending a general email that says "Hey we're on Zulip now", and once people start showing up I'll make the groups.
I also created @T-community/l10n based on the members on rust-lang/team.
I pinged the ES team about the creation of these streams
@vertexclique where should we encourage individual teams to have their discussions?
i'd rather not have everything here. perhaps we can set up another channel?
my hope originally was per-team channels plus an announcements one

Right now we have that, if you count this as the announcements channel.

#t-community/l10n
#t-community/l10n/es
#t-community/l10n/it
#t-community/l10n/ja
#t-community/l10n/pt
#t-community/l10n/ru
#t-community/l10n/tr
#t-community/l10n/zh
The one hiccup with having a announcements channel is zulip currently doesn't support group level permissions, e.g. you can't create a public stream that only a specific team can talk in.

And there are no way to pin a topic to keep this "announcements" topic at the top.

Relevant issues:

https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/10688
https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/1191
Oh! I didn't see those streams, thanks
Hello! French Translation lead here; can we have a stream for fr, please? :slight_smile: â€” can I / should I create it?
heh, I'm sorry that I should have told that there's the stream for french already: #t-community/l10n/fr
you can't create streams btw only admins can xD
